alert.note: Alert for Saguache (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 7:04PM MDT until August 07 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL SAGUACHE COUNTY... At 704 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain have diminished across the warned area. Radar estimates between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen across the area over the past hour, with flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Saguache. This includes the following streams and drainages... Mill Creek, San Luis Creek, Bear Creek, Middle Creek, Saguache Creek, San Isabel Creek, Indian Creek, Jacks Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Ford Creek, Studhorse Creek, Findley Gulch, East Middle Creek, Kerber Creek, Alto Creek, Rito, Rio Grande Canal, Brewery Creek, Flagstaff Creek, Garner Creek and Little Kerber Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
